channel.title: RuneScape, 1996 - 2009. (DeviousMUD)
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt]Welcome[/size]
I've been looking around the internet about the evolution of RuneScape. I'd like to share what I found with this community as I believe it's an interesting story. A student named Andrew Gower decided to make a MMORPG for a college project in 1996. He decided to ask his brother Paul Gower to test the game for him. Paul Gower believed this was an interesting game and should be made public. Andrew Gower decided to name this game "[b]DeviousMUD[/b]". DeviousMUD was an excellent game in it's time but was not really introduced to the public. Andrew Gower decided to make the game public for one week. The game managed to reach 1200 accounts within the week of publicity. The game was then removed from the internet.
[img]http://img7.imageshack.us/img7/300/deviousmud.jpg[/img]
In 1998 Andrew Gower decided to re-write his MMORPG game to re-introduce to the public. Adding membership and basic buttons Andrew Gower began to think this was a great idea. He re-wrote "[b]DeviousMUD[/b]" [i](1998 - 1999)[/i] which was then called "[b]RuneScape Classic[/b]". The game became public and after two weeks the game reached it's limited users. Andrew and Paul Gower decided to expand the servers and use the tradename "[b]Jagex[/b]". RuneScape has expanded to RuneScape 2, RuneScape HD.
Don't believe me? [url=http://www.google.co.uk/]Google it[/url].
I played DeviousMUD on the week of publicity but didn't manage to grab any footage of the game because there was no video recording equipment on the internet. I got one picture on my old computer, sorry for the background desktop.
[img]http://img11.imageshack.us/img11/5216/savce.jpg[/img][/center]

item.description:
@wwe4eva wrote:

@OP;

Your right. It was called DeviousMUD. It’s been on multiple Q&A’s.

DeviousMUD > RuneScape Classic > Runescape 2 > RuneScapeHD (Still RS2 Though.)

Read full topic

The game managed to reach 1200 accounts within the week of publicity. The game was then removed from the internet.

This is bullshit.
[/quote]
actualy its not ;)[/quote]

Bullshit is bullshit. Less then 20-30 people have played DeviousMud. I know 3 and still am friends with one.
Take this bullshit some where else.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape, 1996 - 2009. (DeviousMUD)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote="`Rich, post:11, topic:280628"][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=370636.msg2802649#msg2802649 date=1243539489]

Sigh…

You rs2 noobs have no idea.

First there was Devious MUD

Then in 2001 Runescape was released to the public.

In 2004 Runescape 2 was created, with the previous original version being renamed to “Runescape Classic”.

I hate it when RS2 kids mix up the facts. You guys have no idea.

Sorry if we don’t perform searches about RuneScape daily on Google.
[/quote]

You don’t need to google to know that.[/quote]
Oh, well I don’t play RuneScape much.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape, 1996 - 2009. (DeviousMUD)
item.dc:creator: @Slivion Slivion
item.description:
@Slivion wrote:

No, RuneScape Classic was released before the actual RuneScape graphical updates. He named RuneScape Classic after he re-wrote DeviousMUD.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScape, 1996 - 2009. (DeviousMUD)
item.dc:creator: @SonGoku SonGoku
item.description:
@SonGoku wrote:

It wasn’t called ‘Runescape Classic’ right off the bat. It was called ‘Runescape’ until Rs2 came out. It was then renamed.

They also incorporated Jagex with Constant Tedder, to handle the business aspect (If your over 18, and making profit, you need to have some form of legality surrounding it)

Read full topic
